page.title: 06St. Marys Street Newport
page.content: {St Marys Street}retains many characheristics of Victorian times. The street is{cobbled}and many of the buildings are{restored. Royce is one of them . It was built in 1580 , when it was a college for priests and was called College house Later on it was called The parsage. At one time it was sold to a fishmonger called John Thomson for 400 pounds. Another place in the street is now a hair dressers shop. It is said that a ghost called Mabel haunts it. The 17th century stairs seemed cold ,and the ceiling is 6 feet high. The building itself is 16th century and used to be linked to the Bulls Head across the road. In modern times the street has an annual event called The Old Tyme Market. Which is very popular with the local people.
